measured_by: Continuous scale rating (1-5) for subjective familiarity
justification: Participants rated their familiarity for each image on a continuous scale from 1 to 5, with labels 'sure new,' 'unsure,' and 'sure old' at positions 1, 3, and 5 respectively, indicating the subjective familiarity of items. This measurement was used to assess the influence of familiarity on betting behavior.

measured_by: Probability of reward and source confidence ratings
justification: Participants were asked to select the quadrant where each image had appeared during the encoding phase and then rate their confidence on a continuous scale (1-5). These ratings, along with the subjective probability of reward associated with the source location, indirectly measured the participants' ability to recollect relevant source information for making betting decisions.

measured_by: Subjective Probability of Reward and Betting Behavior
justification: The probability of a bet being rewarded varied based on the quadrant where the scene had appeared in the encoding phase. Participants allocated bets according to the subjective value inferred from source memory and familiarity, allowing an assessment of memory signals' contribution to decision-making.

measured_by: Familiarity ratings and Betting Rates for Lure Items
justification: Participants saw lure images during the betting phase, and rated their familiarity. The effect of familiarity on betting rates was examined for lure items, revealing that familiarity ratings were influential even for unseen items and linked to betting behavior.

measured_by: Confidence Ratings on a Continuous Scale (1-5)
justification: Following source judgments, participants rated their confidence. This measure was used to examine how confidence in recollection, along with familiarity and subjective probability of reward, impacted the likelihood of betting on items.
